net.morimekta.providence.config

Class MessageConfigSupplier<Message extends PMessage<Message,Field>,Field extends PField>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.morimekta.providence.config.MessageConfigSupplier<Message,Field>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Supplier<MessageConfig<Message,Field>>

    public class MessageConfigSupplier<Message extends PMessage<Message,Field>,Field extends PField>
extends Object
implements com.google.common.base.Supplier<MessageConfig<Message,Field>>
    A supplier of a providence message config based on a message reader. For reading a simple message from a readable file, use the FileMessageReader with the PrettySerializer: NOTE: The message reader will be closed after every read, so only message readers that can be reset that way can be supported, e.g. FileMessageReader. MessageConfigSupplier supplier = new MessageConfigSupplier( prefix, MyConfig.kDescriptor, new FileMessageReader(configFile, new PrettySerializer()));

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageConfigSupplier

        public MessageConfigSupplier(String prefix,
                             PMessageDescriptor<Message,Field> descriptor,
                             MessageReader reader)
                      throws IOException
        Create a config that wraps a providence message instance. This message will be exposed without any key prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The config prefix.
        descriptor - The message descriptor of the config root message.
        reader - The message reader containing the config.
        Throws:
        IOException - If message read failed.
        SerializerException - If message deserialization failed.

    • Method Detail

      • getPrefix

        public String getPrefix()
        Get the key prefix used in the config wrapper. All keys in the message structure is prefixed by this value.
        Returns:
        The key prefix.
